review_text: This was my sixth stay (three weeks this time) in the "Treetop FROG," so it feels like home! I love being able to relax in my own private, peaceful space before and after busy days. Having a real kitchen so I can cook a good breakfast is a must, and this one is stocked with all the pans, dishes, and utensils I need. The whole apartment is equally well-equipped, with a large dresser, folding tray tables, plenty of shelves in the bathroom, etc. The wifi is fast and stable. Laura is always extremely responsive, helpful and friendly! The location is very convenient; the quiet neighborhood sits between two main roads, so you can hop on one and be on your way. I highly recommend the FROG!

name: Monica
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2022
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: This treetop studio apartment is cozy, private and peaceful and sits on a beautiful piece of land with a babbling brook in back. My favorite thing to do is sit outside on the deck, drink coffee and listen to nature. It was very clean at check-in and Laura, the owner, lives on site and is very responsive to emails and requests. I texted her that my bathroom sink was draining slowly and she was upstairs within minutes and fixed it. There is no washer/dryer but there is a very clean laundromat about a mile away which Laura recommended. The property is on a quiet, out of the way street but shopping and restaurants are about 5 miles away in any direction and a parking spot is included. The kitchen has full size appliances, dishes and cookware all you need is groceries. I had a very comfortable and enjoyable 3 month stay at Treetop FROG and would happily come back. It felt like home.

review_text: This was my fourth time staying here; twice in 2019 and twice in 2021. I love living in my own little home while in Spartanburg. It's so much quieter and more comfortable than a hotel room, plus it has a full kitchen! (I'm a big fan of a good breakfast.) The location in almost the center of Spartanburg is very convenient - I can get anywhere in the city in under 15 minutes, and I-26 and I-85 are both easy to get to when I need to head to NC or Greenville. I very much appreciated Laura's snack jar; jet lag makes me hungry! She and her family are very nice, and she is extremely responsive to messages. Always a five-star stay!

There are hosts, there ade super hosts, and then there is Laura! From moment one of reserving the FROG, Laura had excellent communication. Her pre check in instructions were spot on.
The FROG rental unit was impeccable. Squeaky clean, well decorated, with lots of extras that many hosts wouldn't think of including.
Her family is wonderful, and we had a wonderful time playing with & feeding her dogs!
The FROG overlooks a creek, so be sure to take advantage of the balcony view that overlooks it. i can't emphasize how her attention to detail is reflected in the unit.
This is one of the best hosts I've had the pleasure of working with, which makes the FROG an incredible value!

name: LeAnne
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2020
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Laura's F.R.O.G. exceeded our expectations! My husband and I spent a week there, and it was perfect for our visit. First, the location is convenient to any part of town, including restaurants only a short drive away in downtown. The suite is cozy, comfortable, and well-designed. The kitchen was a big draw for us when selecting an AirB&B, and it didn't disappoint. It is a full kitchen, and Laura has put a lot of thought into stocking it with dishes, glasses, utensils, pans, dishcloths, spices, coffee/coffeemaker, snacks, and various cooking ingredients. The bed was comfortable, and there were extra covers available, if needed. There was plenty of space in the dresser drawers for us to unpack for the week. As for the setting, you really feel that you are in the trees! We enjoyed hearing the babbling water in the creek out back, and Laura's backyard is so peaceful. One morning, we awoke to the sounds of an owl in the large oak tree in the backyard. We appreciate that Laura doesn't charge a cleaning fee, and she provides ample cleaning supplies for you to clean the suite before you leave. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Spartanburg. Thank you, Laura!

review_text: This was my second time staying here. (My first review, more about the space, was in May 2019.) Laura was once again a wonderful host; I had a special request this time and she was very kind to grant it. The apartment is so peaceful and cozy that I didn't want to leave each morning! Several recent reviews mentioned a train; I am a light sleeper but it never woke me up, and I don't even remember hearing it during my previous stay, so don't let that discourage you. The location is fantastic; I have to run all over the upstate visiting family and friends while I'm in Spartanburg, and from Laura's place I can get to the westside, downtown, I-85 or I-26 in minutes. I highly recommend the Treetop FROG!

The view from the back deck of the room is beautiful overlooking a creek and many large trees. The area is quiet except for hearing a train whistle occasionally. But I would rather hear that than hear other people talking and walking up and down the hall and slamming their doors in a motel. The air conditioning and ceiling fan kept the room at a comfortable temperature. Great place to stay for the weekend while we attended my husband's niece's wedding.

review_text: I LOVED my stay! It is obvious Laura put a lot of thought into designing and furnishing the apartment. There is plenty of storage space, so I could unpack and feel at home rather than have to live out of my suitcase. I felt very safe, which was important to me because I was traveling alone. It was very clean, quiet and comfortable. I appreciated the little extras, such as the bowl of fresh fruit, the spices in the cupboard, and the shampoo/conditioner/body wash dispenser in the shower. The kitchen was well-furnished and the appliances worked well. I enjoyed relaxing on the sofa after breakfast with my coffee and a view of big green oak leaves (it really is like living in a treetop!), watching the news on the Roku TV and listening to the birds singing. I hope I can book Laura's "FROG" every time I visit Spartanburg; I will be sad if I have to stay in a hotel there again!

review_text: Amazing find for me and my family during a very stressful move from the area. Laurie was flexible with our check-in time when we needed the townhome a little earlier in the day due to our hectic move out schedule. Extremely easy to enter the home with specific check-in instructions. Immaculate accommodations with so many personal touches!! She even had dog treats available for our dog! Coffee, snacks, cold water bottles waiting in the refrigerator, laundry supplies....all were provided. Wonderful location convenient to retail & restaurants in the area. Great fenced in backyard for a dog. Thankfully we were able to extend our stay for an extra night when needed. Laurie was flexible and responsive to all communications. I can't say enough positive things about this experience. It was such a relief to have this townhome during a stressful time and Laurie is an AMAZING host! Thank you for allowing us to spend our last nights in South Carolina in your lovely townhome.

Debbie’s Charming Teal House is charming, teal and more! It was the perfect setting for a weeklong getaway that was a mix of work and fun.
We were in Spartanburg for our son’s rugby games at nearby USC Upstate. We opted to work remotely a few days, and three of us easily managed virtual meetings at desks and tables in different parts of the house with great wifi.
We took long walks in the beautiful tree-lined neighbourhood and nearby Croft Nature Preserve. We enjoyed delicious meals at Debbie’s restaurant recommendations and cooked by us in her fully equipped kitchen with teal accents.
Thank you Debbie for the perfect home for our first visit to South Carolina!

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I was excited to get a reservation at the Teal House. It’s a wonderful craftsman bungalow. We arrived at night to a dark house without exterior lighting. Upon daylight we could see the grass was overgrown. The porch had not been swept. A large nest is on an inside post. There are cobwebs on the front bricks, including from the light fixtures to the doorway. The inside window blinds are broken and unworkable. The chairs in the family room are terribly soiled. The screen door to the deck would not close. The laundry appliance buttons are broken. We were expecting charming, not under maintenanced. We expected a better presentation from a 5-Star accommodation. Southern hospitality was not at the Teal House during our visit.

The location of the house is perfect. The neighborhood is beautiful; old Converse Heights, and so nice for walking our dog.
Our granddaughter stays with us at Teal House, and our son and family come over for meals. There's plenty of room for family dinners. If we decide to cook, the kitchen is well stocked with everything we need. The fenced back yard is super convenient for letting our dog out at night. We come to Spartanburg as often as possible to visit family. We've found our go to place at Charming Teal House.

review_text:
We've stayed in the Charming Teal House twice and will be returning in April. The house works for us because it has everything we need, including a fenced backyard to let our dog out in, is close to our son's house in Converse Heights and close to our granddaughter's school. It's also a beautiful neighborhood for walking our dog. The kitchen is well stocked with utensils and there are two TV's; one in the family room and one in the living room. If I could change anything, it would be to have a sofa and maybe one or two chairs in the family room instead of three easy chairs. I'd also put a TV in the master bedroom. We bring our own TV for that room; but my husband is an engineer and is able to hook it up easily. There is a great space for a smaller TV there.
We look forward to returning in April!
Angie Adams
Panama City, FL

review_text:
The house is nice and in a good neighborhood. Never had a need to contact the host, everything was as promised and had no issues. I only sent a message to let them know I left.
I was skeptical when I read that the downstairs was air conditioned, but the upstairs only had window units in the bedrooms. I couldn’t find any comments in it, so her ya go. We stayed in August and it was HOT outside. The window units kept the bedrooms cold. The bathroom is a “jack and hill” bathroom, so as long as you keep one or both of the bedroom doors open to the bathroom , it will keep the bathroom comfortable. If you close both doors to the bathroom, it will get warm.

More than enough room for my group, the different parts of the house made it fun, very spacious closet. Our favorite room was the sun room back of the house... We all were able to relax, watch movies and get a little sunshine. 1 of our nights, we all slept on the floor with sleeping bags (Planned) as if we were coming due to open windows. Oan the jetted tub was a surprise. Work very well... Overall, I look forward to taken another 2 hour trip just to enjoy this home again. I highly recommend this home, especially for big family's or groups.

review_text: We greatly enjoyed our summer week in Spartanburg at the Teal House. We loved the touches of teal everywhere, especially the teal microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. The house was well-equipped with all we needed and there was plenty of space for our family of 6 to spread out. We especially liked the large front porch for cooler mornings and evenings, and the light and sunny air-conditioned sunroom for the hotter parts of the day. We took advantage of the gas grill for dinner one evening. Since my wife and I both grew up in Spartanburg and love trains, we enjoyed hearing the occasional low sound of distant trains coming and going.

review_text:
This place is a BIG house. I suppose that is relative of course but it was plenty of space for my partner and I, as well as our two greyhounds. Everything was perfectly clean with plenty of spare towels. We stayed here because a tree fell on our house so it acted as the perfect home away from home during our non-vacation. The kitchen was also equipped with most things that you would need in terms of cookware. I actually thought that for an airbandb, the knives and pans were quite nice. As others have noted, the sunroom is an incredible feature. There is a heater in there if you're chilly during the winter.
A thoughtful touch of this home is that there are outlets EVERYWHERE. My partner works from home so he needed to plug in his laptop, cell phones, etc. There were surge protectors, and outlets galore.
You can also stay up to date with your shows via the two Roku tvs.
Just be aware of the school drop off times and you're going to have a great stay.

name: Wade

2 days ago
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Honest representation of an ideal rental for a family with pets. The home is in an established neighborhood with mature foliage/trees. Immediate residents (neighbors next door/across the street) are friendly and welcoming. Walking distance to a Starbucks (literally 50m from the home) and grocery store/premier German restaurant (1.2 miles). Well maintained, no odor of pets and a large, fenced backyard.
Minor concerns:
- Road in front of the house (near restaurant/Starbucks) was closed/under construction on a select portion. Not unbearably noisy during the day and absolutely quiet at night.
- The neighborhood is abundant with large dogs. All the dogs are controlled within a fenced area; when walking the neighborhood you will be “announced”. 😊😊 Neighbors have two large dogs. I was worried as one of my dogs is dog aggressive; she showed no sign of aggression towards the neighbor’s dogs. Simply annotating for owners of dogs with anxiety/aggression issues.

Very nice stay and just as described. Hostess was very responsive, communicated very well and very flexible and professional. The property was clean and very spacious and well kept with nice upgrades in a very well renovated home. The site was also very safe and near various restaurants and grocery stores and businesses as needed.....all within a block but property was still very quiet and in a nice neighborhood! Kitchen was stocked thoughtfully with spices and all the dishes and gadgets you might need. Top it off, Jessica was a friendly, responsive and thoughtful host. Hope to visit again!

review_text: We actually live in town, but had to vacate our home while our crawlspace was being worked on. Leaving our home, yet not being on vacation, was not very exciting to the wife and kids. Anytime you are uprooted, it is stressful for the family. Every place we were trying to stay - whether with family, or our church, fell through. Found this new townhome on Airbnb, and I can’t express how grateful we were to have discovered Natalia and her home. To have a place all to ourselves, with close proximity to Target, Costco, and a bunch of restaurants… incredible. We were very much at home. Relaxed. And when we needed to extend our stay, because the work was taking longer than expected on our home, it was no problem at all! It was honestly perfect. Can’t give enough stars. We are very, very grateful!

review_text:
Unique urban loft. I loved the 12 foot windows and cool lighting. Decor was stylish, yet simple and calm. The bed and pillows were super comfortable, and the bedrooms were dark and quiet, so that we slept well. Enjoyed hanging out and catching up with my daughter in this space. We cooked dinner together, talked and watched a movie. We both had our own room and bathroom. Way better than just a hotel room. We both agreed that we could live in that loft!
I very much appreciated the host providing coffee. (I brought creamer from home...but that might be a nice added touch to have for future guests) There were all the kitchen basics we needed to cook dinner, even olive oil.
The only thing about the listing that was not accurate, was that there were not the bathrobes as advertised. (First world problem, I know, but I was still a little bummed) I let the host know, and he said he would update the listing.
We really enjoyed our stay.

review_text: Morgan and Elizabeth were great to work with. There were a couple of glitches at the start but they did their best to rectify the situation (for example....there were 5 women staying in the loft but only 4 towels, 4 cups, 4 forks, etc.) Additional supplies were delivered to us as soon as possible. The loft was very comfortable, and we loved the nearby train. There is no coffee pot other than a pour over. Had never used one before but quickly adapted and pleasantly surprised with the coffee quality. Not ready to get rid of my plug in but glad to have another coffee option! A couple of suggestions for the future....add a couple of night lights in the bathrooms, increase number of towels available, include small sheets and blanket for sofa. Overall, we five were comfortable and pleased with our stay. Thank you.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Inside was really, really nice...the high ceilings and overall aesthetics were just as described. There's only one elevator, on the other side of the building, so the stairs are where you'll likely have to walk and there are a lot of them, so tough when you're bringing your things up or down plus parking is not close tot he entrance - so overall just a lot of walking. Most everything was great - and this is no fault of Morgan - but there is a constant smell of marijuana in the hallway. This is on management, but it's not pleasant and just takes away from the beauty of this place. The furniture and beds are very comfortable and although we didn't use them, the washer/dryer are a nice amenity. There were some unfolded (used?) blankets in the main closet, so not sure if they were clean. The air mattress was perfect for my teenager and all in all we had a nice stay.

The reason this matters is because prior to finalizing booking, I asked if we could bring our dog, who is extremely reactive, to which she answered yes. If I hadn’t noticed her dog in the back yard and let me dog off leash, we could have had a very dangerous situation.
Beyond that, the toilet was gross, and there was hair ball in the tub drain. Not worth what we paid for, will definitely not be returning for the lack of cleanliness and lack of consideration.

On a side note, there was a pet fee that was added on the day of my arrival that I did not know about prior to the trip. Kathryn cut the fee in half, but as a girl on a budget, I would have considered this fee when I was selecting locations. Overall, it was a good stay, close to my Aunt's house and a back yard for the dog to run around, and a safe neighborhood for walking. They were patient with my barking puppy too.

We stayed at Ivan’s for a wedding in town and were delighted to walk in for the first time to see the place. It is spotless and features state of the art everything. All amenities and appliances were top of the line. The porch was lovely, and the neighborhood is quiet. We were never more than 5-8 minutes drive from anything we wanted to do.
The train does come through at night but we were not bothered as a group of six. It seems to come through all parts of Spartanburg though.
The only thing missing are some lamps in the bedrooms for reading at night—otherwise a flawless destination for all of your needs!

name: Melanie
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
First, the positives: the house itself is a sight to behold, boasting exquisite finishes and thoughtful personal touches that added warmth to our stay. The bathrooms and kitchen were well-equipped with all the essentials, and the beds were incredibly comfortable, providing a cozy retreat at the end of a long day.
However, our experience was marred by one significant downside – the incessant noise from the nearby train line. Despite the allure of the comfortable beds, we found it nearly impossible to get any rest due to the trains passing by roughly once an hour throughout the night. The disruption to our sleep left us feeling less than refreshed and somewhat disappointed.
While Ivan's home is undeniably beautiful and well-appointed, the constant noise from the train line significantly detracted from our overall enjoyment. For future guests, come prepared with earplugs or noise-canceling headphones in order to mitigate the impact on sleep quality.

review_text: With my many travels and stays at numerous Airbnbs Ivans luxury oasis is by far the nicest I’ve seen and stayed in. ( pix don’t do it justice.) We enjoyed every bit of it and never wanted to leave the house, which is perfectly renovated as if something you would see in a magazine.. Ivan’s house felt very cozy and inviting. All the mattresses were super comfortable with high-end linen and very soft comforters. I specially enjoyed my early mornings on the back porch with my perfect coffee made by the fanciest coffee machine I have seen. My wife enjoyed cooking in the gourmet kitchen, which includes anything and everything from a mixer to a blender all the pots and pans necessary to create any dish and plenty of dinnerware for all. We were amazed at the variety of spices and teas that were included not to mention raw honey and even gourmet hot chocolate for the kids. With all the available amenities, it seemed like Ivan specifically tailored this house for our needs. We will definitel

review_text:
We enjoyed our stay immensely in this tranquil, super clean, clutter-free, odor-free, well organized Airbnb. The kitchen is amazing - you can make any meal you want or simply use the nice bbq outside then enjoy it inside or deck with elegant dinnerware/silverware.
I loved the fact that there’s an on-site new washer and dryer and a space to work remotely with printer, just bring your laptop. To top it off, enjoy a delicious espresso (or latte-just bring your raw milk 🤣) as soon as you wake up or anytime the desire hits! There’s a few varieties of nice teas and hot chocolate.
Host Ivan is amazing!!! He responded within mere seconds and was there with recommendations and answers to our questions. Definitely worth the stay and will be back soon 🥰 We highly recommend this place!!!

Parking is available nearby (City Hall parking lot next to the police station) and the owner lives next door and is therefore quickly accessible if there is anything. Contactless and uncomplicated check in and check out. Good recommendation for a central stay in Spartanburg!

review_text: This location was a good value. The property manager was very nice and helpful. This location is right downtown in the busy part of the square. It was fun to walk out the front door and right into Music on Main. Beware that on Thursdays, parking is very difficult due to Music on Main. I was not prepared to hunt for a space quite a ways away from the condo after working all day. The bed was comfortable but outside noise is very loud, bring a sound machine. This airbnb is a great value but be prepared for the noise and the parking. It is a cute space!

review_text: Great place! Very convenient with 24 parking lot right across the street & so many walkable restaurants. Loved that the square was right outside the building! The apartment looked just like the pictures- loved the exposed brick! Very spacious yet cozy. A couple things I will add but wouldn’t be things I would “dock” per say are that if you can’t do stairs this isn’t the place for you. Was fine for us but just be sure you know prior to booking. Also you are right downtown so there’s lots of “city noise” (cars, sirens, construction work, etc). If you are used to that then not a problem. We live in the middle of nowhere so that was an adjustment for us. Just bring your own noise machine or phone app & you’ll be fine! But just keep in mind. But other than those things it’s a great spot & we would stay again!

We did however feel very safe as the doors to get into the building were locked at all times and needed a code to gain access. There were also about 30 stairs to get to the apartment which was not at all a problem for us but something to keep in mind. I would absolutely recommend this space and would stay here again.

review_text:
Was visiting our son at Wofford. This was our first stay with Anna, and we will hope to stay with her every visit to Spartanburg! This spot is a hidden gem, indeed! Both comfortable, and charming, and the location could not be any better if you really want to experience downtown Spartanburg! After a long drive, we walked out the front door to a magical night of dining (SO many spots to choose from) with live music on the street - it was perfect! Just what we needed to recharge our batteries!
The added beauty is inside we never heard anything and you would not know you were in the middle of a bustling downtown scene!
Anna was responsive to questions I had before the visit and was an excellent host! Couldn't recommend this spot more strongly if you like charm and historic character!

name: Kathleen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2018
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
My first visit to Spartanburg and I loved this space! Very well situated in downtown area ...walking distance to shops, restaurants, Starbucks, and live music. Apartment is in a vintage building, up one long flight of stairs from sidewalk--two large rooms, nicely decorated, comfortable furniture. Music and nightlife is audible in the evening, but at the end, lulled me to sleep. It was cold when I visited, so it was nice to have control of the heat, and it functioned well. There seems to be parking available in the back, but it is small and shared at times by many people because of the nightlife. 2 hr. free parking on the street out front..I had access to both front and back which was convenient
The one bathroom is clean and nicely done- on the small side w shower and tub. Its shared by a hallway between the two rooms: The bedroom has a comfortable Kingsize bed with nice linens. The other room holds the kitchen and a small table and 2 chairs--I would not try to cook a meal; not enough seating or complete dish ware--restaurants or takeout the better choice...the other side of the open air room has an oversized comfy chair w pullout twin size mattress, and a large plush velvet sofa and TV. Apartment seems like a perfect size for 1, 2 or 3 people. Even 4 if necessary, as there is an air mattress available...I called the host, with questions, 3 different times and heard back from him within 20 minutes each time. I would visit again!

My daughter and her husband recently moved to the neighborhood, so it was so convenient to spend time with them and to walk to restaurants downtown. They are expecting their first baby (!) soon, so I will be sending this recommendation to other family members when they visit the new baby. We are definitely coming back to the Red Door!

I wish I'd been able to book this great little house for longer! I was staying there on my own, but there definitely would have been room for another person without feeling like we were on top of one another.
Jawaan was super responsive, helpful and friendly.
I'd also flag, which I didn't pay attention to because I'd previously been staying in another rental previously so I had a lot of things with me, but Jawaan has this perfectly set up for long & short term stays. The kitchen in particular felt like a kitchen I could really cook in without having to buy a bunch of stuff to make it feasible. Definitely helped with the 'walk right in' feel to the whole place.
It's very quiet & clean, and I'll definitely look into booking again.
Like everyone else, I'll say that the driveway is very steep & a bit narrow, but with my back-up camera I didn't have any issues.

name: Becky
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Amandela's Bohemian Loft is a spacious and beautiful loft apartment in a nice neighborhood. We were in Spartanburg for a conference and it was just a four-minute drive to downtown where the conference was being held. We had off-street parking with a well-lit stairway to the loft. The air-conditioned space was a welcome respite after a busy day and the huge shower was really nice. The wood flooring is gorgeous, the decor is clean and modern. The lighting is a little tricky to figure out as many are on the same circuit with the switches located near the kitchen. The bed was firm but comfortable. If you like white noise, bring a small fan as the ceiling fan is on the same circuit as the bedroom area light and cannot be left on separately. Our only note would be to lower the bedside shelves so they can be reached easily from the bed and have a light next to the bed that can be turned off from the bed. I would definitely stay here again, it was lovely!

This Loft was amazing! The recliner sealed the deal for me! 😄
I’m a sucker for huge TVs but this one was nice too.
The loft was well laid out to make efficient use of the space! I enjoyed the shower and everything that was available to use on our stay!
Everything is nearby! Shops, restaurants, grocery stores, plazas, downtown, churches, salons!
Even got a mani done 😆
If you ever need any Salon or Esthetician services done make sure to go to Kenneth Shuler and ask for Sabrina! The service and product discounts there are amazing as well!
I definitely enjoyed my stay and if I can get the time off from work, I’ll be booking again next month‼️
Oh, and Amandela’s communication and response time was A1! She was soooo nice, prompt, and accommodating to all our requests!
Thanks again for an amazing stay!

review_text:
What a great property!!
We wondered if it would be too small and cramped. Just the opposite! It is very spacious and beautifully decorated.
We had everything we needed and were very comfortable staying there.
The bed was great! Which we truly appreciate. You just never know what you are gonna get and a good night’s sleep is priceless!!
Thank you for everything!!
We highly recommend the Bohemian studio and hope to return ourselves!
The only hitch we had was
the AC quit while we were there, but Amandela generously offered to put us up at the AC Hotel!! We declined. Being Oct, the weather was mild and we were gone most of the time, as we were in town for a family reunion.
Instead I suggested a couple of fans might be nice in the evening. She had 2 large box fans delivered right away. We did use one, and that made us perfectly comfortable. They had an AC Repair man scheduled for the day we left. Very efficient!
The personal attention and generous offer of a hotel room was greatly appreciated.
Great property and great host! We will gladly return!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Clean, functional, and stylish. Ample room and amenities for a night or a week, with the full kitchen and washer/dryer. The oak floors are beautiful. Comfortable queen bed, and a double-reclining sofa that I'm glad we don't have - we would be in it way too much. The shower is one of the more enjoyable ones I've ever used; large, and with good ventilation.
Give the A/C time to catch up if the day is very warm. We set it to the temperature we wanted, went out to dinner, and when we got back it was up-to-speed. Note that this is a walk up (in the attic space of a one-story building) so be prepared for the equivalent of two flights of stairs.
The Loft is about a mile from the trendy part of town, which has a nice evening vibe. Parking is not hard to find (at least during the week when we were there). I recommend the Loft.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We rented this place for my daughter's bridal party to use for getting ready the day of her wedding at Indigo Hall. It was just a couple of blocks from the venue and was very spacious. We had plenty of room for the bridal party(6), moms(2) and 2 hair/makeup ladies. The natural light from the rooms was absolutely perfect! This is the cutest place and super clean. Emily stayed in contact with me throughout the entire booking. As we got close to our check in date, there was a little confusion (my fault). Emily called me to clarify rather than messaging back and forth, which I thought was top notch customer service, because you can't tell tone or intent over messages. She was so polite and accommodating. I would definitely recommend staying here if you are out of town or if you are a bridal party looking for a place to get ready the day of your wedding. The photos in front of the brick windows are amazing!

name: Roxanne
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: I have been at some air bnbs where pictures made it look better, and then there is this one. The pictures did this place no justice. I saw the photos and thought oh what a nice, decent sized place. Then, we go there and walked in. Wow. The rooms were twice the size of the photos. The terrace was so nice, and they thought of everything. There was water in the fridge, coffee supplied, laundry detergent and sheets provided. The beds were super comfortable. The closets were huge, and loved having makeup desks with a chair and mirror in each bedroom. The huge windows provided great lighting, and it was absolutely wonderful having 2.5 bathrooms with myself and my 2 daughters staying here. Communication was easy and great, Emily even texted when the alarm company alerted her that the front door wasnt closed fully. There was the cutest ice cream shop next door, a playground across the street, and a coffee shop next door. Everything you could need within walking distance. I loved this place,and will definitely book the next time we visit here. 10 stars!!!

review_text: From the beginning, Emily was extremely communicative and helpful. My colleague and I had to extend our stay, and Emily very promptly adjusted the reservation. In addition, she provides a great guide to Spartanburg. The location of the apartment is amazing - right in the heart of downtown next to restaurants, ice cream shops, coffee shops, and boutiques. When we checked in, there was a small issue with the lock but Emily quickly reset it remotely and was available via phone or text to help us out. The place itself is STUNNING - high ceilings, a ton of natural light, the bedrooms are spacious, and the deck out back is nice to take your morning coffee. My colleague and I are so happy we chose to stay here instead of a hotel chain somewhere across town. We will be back again!!

Planned a little staycation getaway for me and my love for Valentine's and it was the most romantic and soothing getaway. Close to downtown, walking distance from local restaurants, bars and the view was very calming and peaceful. I HIGHLY recommend Emily's place. You will not regret not one moment. Emily was awesome, easy to get in touch with, even had cold beverages available upon arrival. Definitely will be staying again!
